Often clarified info without having to be asked so you would understand. Only problem being three sources of notes that you had to memorize all of them in order to really succeed. Would take agai

comments: Dr. Jenkins is a great professor and an easily approachable guy. However, his classes are pretty difficult so paying attention in class and following along in the books are a must in the class. His tests are easily the hardest among Psych classes I\'ve taken but he is always available for questions.

tag_professor: Respected (2)  Amazing lectures (2)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (2)  ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS (2)  Caring (2)  Clear grading criteria (1)  EXTRA CREDIT (1)  Tough Grader (1)  TEST HEAVY (1)  SO MANY PAPERS (1)  Gives good feedback (1)  LECTURE HEAVY (1)  Inspirational (1)
stu_tags: INSPIRATIONAL  EXTRA CREDIT  SO MANY PAPERS
comments: Dr. Jenkins is a friendly, fairly easy teacher. For those planning to take him for INT 101 -- Be prepared to write papers. He does give a good amount of time for you to write them. 5-7 pages is the average paper length in his class. He\'s very tough on citations so make sure you\'ve got APA style down. The SIs will help you tremendously with papers!

comments: Drugs and Behavior is a fantastic course and I would recommend anyone studying psychology to take it. Dr. Jenkins definitely knows the material and is passionate about it, and it is evident in his lectures. Class is optional, but skipping class will not do you any favors because the tests typically are lecture-heavy.

comments: Drugs & Behavior is an excellent class. Bill is very passionate and very knowledgeable about drugs from an academic standpoint. He did his post-doc on drugs. His lectures are thorough, but you will still need to readskim the book for tests. He gives feedback quickly, and it is really useful feedback.

comments: An approachable and laid-back teacher who is always well-prepared with both work and knowledge. Very reasonable. He was my teacher and mentor, and miss him now that I\'ve graduated. Pay attention in class and take his studying suggestions seriously and you\'ll do well!

tag_professor: Respected (2)  Amazing lectures (2)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (2)  ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS (2)  Caring (2)  Clear grading criteria (1)  EXTRA CREDIT (1)  Tough Grader (1)  TEST HEAVY (1)  SO MANY PAPERS (1)  Gives good feedback (1)  LECTURE HEAVY (1)  Inspirational (1)
comments: Bill is awesome! His class was sooo much fun! We would take the first 5 mins to talk about whatever is on our mind then get down to work! Very important to attend class and take good notes! If you do, you will do well on exams. Also, take good notes on the "conceptual" material, not just the math, because that will be the MC part of test.

comments: Dr Jenkins was a great teacher. Although he taught from powerpoint presentations, he still managed to keep class interesting. Very passionate about psychology and teaching. Book is not needed, as long as you take good notes every lecture and pay attention to the video clips. It\'s probably the best 9 AM class i\'ll ever take.

If I needed a class he taught I would look for him again. It was hard to study for because I didn\'t have any clue as to what he thought was important enough to test over

comments: Dr. Jenkins is a great teacher. This is a good class for both slackers and people who want to learn. He\'s easy and fair but will take the time to expalin any and every thing that you care to ask him about. He posts his lectures but some test questions (very few) come from in class discussions. You can pass even if you don\'t show up.

comments: Dr. Jenkin\'s is a wonderful professor, loves his subject. Tests aren\'t too difficult, all comes from his lectures, don\'t really need to purchase the book even. Would def. recommend him to anyone needing to take Intro to Psych, he makes it really fun and interesting!
